module.name: CustWeb
module.short: Base functionality for HTTP hosting implementations

descr.p: The custweb unit provides the base functionality common to all HTTP hosting implementations in Free Pascal: CGI, FastCGI, HTTP server and Apache loadable modules. It contains the foundational classes TWebHandler and TCustomWebApplication that handle HTTP requests and provide web application functionality.

The unit supports module-based request handling, error management, event logging, and various configuration options for different hosting environments. It provides the infrastructure for routing requests to appropriate HTTP modules and managing the complete request-response cycle.

element.name: TWebHandler
element.short: Base class for handling HTTP requests in web applications

descr.p: TWebHandler is the core component that handles HTTP requests in web applications. It provides the framework for routing requests to appropriate HTTP modules, handling errors, and managing the request-response cycle. This class serves as the foundation for all HTTP hosting implementations including CGI, FastCGI, HTTP server and Apache modules.
The handler supports both legacy routing and new HTTP routing systems, module lifecycle management, error handling with custom exception display, and event logging.

errors.p: May raise HTTP-related exceptions during request processing.

element.name: TWebHandler.Create
element.short: Creates a new web handler instance

descr.p: Creates and initializes a new TWebHandler instance with default settings. Sets up default module variable name, enables default module handling, and configures request handling options.

errors.p: May raise exceptions during component initialization.

element.name: TWebHandler.Create.AOwner
element.short: The owner component for the web handler

element.name: TWebHandler.Destroy
element.short: Destroys the web handler instance

descr.p: Cleans up resources and destroys the TWebHandler instance. Resets module factory event handlers and performs standard component cleanup.

errors.p: No specific errors expected during destruction.

element.name: TWebHandler.Run
element.short: Main request processing loop for the web handler

descr.p: Starts the main request processing loop that waits for incoming HTTP requests and handles them. Continues processing until the handler is terminated, calling idle events between requests when available.

errors.p: May raise exceptions during request waiting or processing.

element.name: TWebHandler.Log
element.short: Logs an event message using the configured log handler

descr.p: Logs an event message with the specified event type if a log event handler is assigned. Provides centralized logging for web application events and errors.

errors.p: No specific errors, depends on log handler implementation.

element.name: TWebHandler.Log.EventType
element.short: The type of event being logged

element.name: TWebHandler.Log.Msg
element.short: The message text to log

element.name: TWebHandler.DoHandleRequest
element.short: Handles a complete HTTP request with error handling and cleanup

descr.p: Processes a complete HTTP request including error handling, response sending, and proper cleanup of request and response objects. Ensures content is sent even if not explicitly sent by the handler, and logs any content sending errors.

errors.p: Handles and logs content sending errors internally.

element.name: TWebHandler.DoHandleRequest.ARequest
element.short: The HTTP request to process

element.name: TWebHandler.DoHandleRequest.AResponse
element.short: The HTTP response to send

element.name: TWebHandler.HandleRequest
element.short: Routes and processes an HTTP request to the appropriate handler

descr.p: Routes an HTTP request to the appropriate handler using either legacy routing or the HTTP router system. Catches and handles any exceptions that occur during request processing by calling the exception handler.

errors.p: Catches all exceptions during request processing and handles them via ShowRequestException.

element.name: TWebHandler.HandleRequest.ARequest
element.short: The HTTP request to route and process

element.name: TWebHandler.HandleRequest.AResponse
element.short: The HTTP response to populate

element.name: TWebHandler.HandleGetOnPost
element.short: Controls whether GET requests are handled by POST handlers

descr.p: When True, allows POST request handlers to also process GET requests. This provides flexibility for web applications that need to handle both request types with the same logic.

element.name: TWebHandler.RedirectOnError
element.short: Controls whether errors trigger HTTP redirects

descr.p: When True, exceptions during request processing cause an HTTP redirect to the URL specified in RedirectOnErrorURL. When False, errors are displayed as HTML error pages.

element.name: TWebHandler.RedirectOnErrorURL
element.short: URL template for error redirects

descr.p: Specifies the URL pattern used for error redirects when RedirectOnError is True. The URL can contain format specifiers to include error message details in the redirect.

element.name: TWebHandler.ApplicationURL
element.short: Base URL for the web application

descr.p: Specifies the base URL for the web application. When empty, the application URL is determined from the request script name. Used for constructing absolute URLs and setting module base URLs.

element.name: TWebHandler.AllowDefaultModule
element.short: Controls whether requests without module names use default modules

descr.p: When True, requests that don't specify a module name will use the default module specified in DefaultModuleName. When False, requests without module names result in an error.

element.name: TWebHandler.DefaultModuleName
element.short: Name of the default HTTP module for requests without explicit module names

descr.p: Specifies which HTTP module to use when a request doesn't explicitly specify a module name and AllowDefaultModule is True. If empty and only one module is registered, that module becomes the default.

element.name: TWebHandler.ModuleVariable
element.short: Query parameter name for specifying HTTP module names

descr.p: Specifies the name of the query parameter used to determine which HTTP module should handle a request. Defaults to 'Module'. For example, '?Module=MyModule' would route to the MyModule HTTP module.

element.name: TWebHandler.OnGetModule
element.short: Event for custom module selection logic

descr.p: Event called to determine which HTTP module class should handle a request. Allows custom module selection logic based on request properties, overriding the default module name resolution.

element.name: TWebHandler.Email
element.short: Administrator email address for error notifications

descr.p: Email address displayed in error pages for user contact. Used in HTML error pages to provide a contact point for error reporting.

element.name: TWebHandler.Title
element.short: Application title displayed in error pages

descr.p: Title of the web application used in error page headers and titles. Provides branding and identification in error responses.

element.name: TWebHandler.Administrator
element.short: Administrator name for error pages

descr.p: Name of the application administrator displayed in error pages. Used together with the email address to provide contact information for error reporting.

element.name: TWebHandler.OnShowRequestException
element.short: Event for custom exception handling during request processing

descr.p: Event called when an exception occurs during HTTP request processing. Allows custom handling of exceptions before the default error response is generated.

element.name: TWebHandler.OnIdle
element.short: Event triggered when the handler is idle between requests

descr.p: Event called between request processing cycles when the handler is waiting for new requests. Allows background processing or cleanup tasks during idle periods.

element.name: TWebHandler.OnLog
element.short: Event for logging web application events and errors

descr.p: Event called when the web application needs to log events or errors. Allows custom logging implementation for web application diagnostics.

element.name: TWebHandler.OnUnknownRequestEncoding
element.short: Event for handling unknown request content encodings

descr.p: Event called when the HTTP request contains content with an unknown or unsupported encoding. Allows custom handling of request content encoding issues.

element.name: TWebHandler.OnInitModule
element.short: Event for initializing HTTP modules before request processing

descr.p: Event called when an HTTP module is initialized before processing a request. Allows custom setup and configuration of module properties.

element.name: TWebHandler.PreferModuleName
element.short: Controls whether module name extraction is preferred over path info parsing

descr.p: When True, the handler prefers extracting module names from path info even when path contains multiple segments. Affects how module names are determined from request URLs.

element.name: TWebHandler.LegacyRouting
element.short: Controls whether to use legacy request routing instead of HTTP router

descr.p: When True, uses the original request routing mechanism instead of the HTTP router system. Provides backward compatibility with older web applications.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication
element.short: Base class for web applications with integrated request handling

descr.p: TCustomWebApplication extends TCustomApplication to provide web-specific functionality. It integrates a TWebHandler instance for processing HTTP requests and provides properties for configuring web application behavior.

This class serves as the foundation for all web application implementations including CGI, FastCGI, and other HTTP hosting environments. It handles application lifecycle, event logging, and web handler management.

errors.p: May raise exceptions during web handler initialization or request processing.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.Create
element.short: Creates and initializes a new web application instance

descr.p: Creates a new TCustomWebApplication instance and initializes the web handler through the abstract InitializeWebHandler method. Sets up event handlers for termination and logging.

errors.p: May raise exceptions during web handler initialization.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.Create.AOwner
element.short: The owner component for the web application

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.Destroy
element.short: Destroys the web application and cleans up resources

descr.p: Destroys the web application instance, freeing the web handler and event log resources. Performs proper cleanup of all web application components.

errors.p: No specific errors expected during destruction.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.CreateForm
element.short: Creates a component instance with the web handler as owner

descr.p: Creates an instance of the specified component class with the web handler as the owner component. Provides a way to create forms and components within the web application context.

errors.p: May raise exceptions during component creation.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.CreateForm.AClass
element.short: The component class to instantiate

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.CreateForm.Reference
element.short: Variable to store the created component reference

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.Initialize
element.short: Initializes the web application with error handling enabled

descr.p: Initializes the web application and enables StopOnException to ensure proper error handling. Calls the inherited initialization from TCustomApplication.

errors.p: May raise exceptions during application initialization.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.Terminate
element.short: Terminates the web application and web handler

descr.p: Terminates the web application by first calling the inherited termination and then terminating the web handler if it's still running. Ensures clean shutdown of the web request processing loop.

errors.p: No specific errors expected during termination.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.HandleGetOnPost
element.short: Controls whether GET requests are handled by POST handlers

descr.p: Delegates to the TWebHandler.HandleGetOnPost property. When True, allows POST request handlers to also process GET requests.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.RedirectOnError
element.short: Controls whether errors trigger HTTP redirects

descr.p: Delegates to the TWebHandler.RedirectOnError property. When True, exceptions during request processing cause an HTTP redirect.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.RedirectOnErrorURL
element.short: URL template for error redirects

descr.p: Delegates to the TWebHandler.RedirectOnErrorURL property. Specifies the URL pattern used for error redirects.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.ApplicationURL
element.short: Base URL for the web application

descr.p: Delegates to the TWebHandler.ApplicationURL property. Specifies the base URL for the web application.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.AllowDefaultModule
element.short: Controls whether requests without module names use default modules

descr.p: Delegates to the TWebHandler.AllowDefaultModule property. When True, requests without module names use the default module.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.DefaultModuleName
element.short: Name of the default HTTP module

descr.p: Delegates to the TWebHandler.DefaultModuleName property. Specifies the default HTTP module for requests without explicit module names.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.ModuleVariable
element.short: Query parameter name for specifying HTTP module names

descr.p: Delegates to the TWebHandler.ModuleVariable property. Specifies the query parameter name used to determine module names.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.OnGetModule
element.short: Event for custom module selection logic

descr.p: Delegates to the TWebHandler.OnGetModule property. Event called to determine which HTTP module class should handle a request.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.Email
element.short: Administrator email address for error notifications

descr.p: Delegates to the TWebHandler.Email property. Email address displayed in error pages for user contact.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.Administrator
element.short: Administrator name for error pages

descr.p: Delegates to the TWebHandler.Administrator property. Name of the application administrator displayed in error pages.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.OnShowRequestException
element.short: Event for custom exception handling during request processing

descr.p: Delegates to the TWebHandler.OnShowRequestException property. Event called when an exception occurs during HTTP request processing.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.OnUnknownRequestEncoding
element.short: Event for handling unknown request content encodings

descr.p: Delegates to the TWebHandler.OnUnknownRequestEncoding property. Event called when request contains content with unknown encoding.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.EventLog
element.short: Event log instance for logging web application events

descr.p: Provides access to the event log used by the web application for logging events and errors. The event log is created automatically when first accessed and configured for system logging.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.PreferModuleName
element.short: Controls module name extraction preference

descr.p: Delegates to the TWebHandler.PreferModuleName property. Controls whether module name extraction is preferred over path info parsing.

element.name: TCustomWebApplication.LegacyRouting
element.short: Controls whether to use legacy request routing

descr.p: Delegates to the TWebHandler.LegacyRouting property. When True, uses legacy routing instead of the HTTP router system.

element.name: EFpWebError
element.short: Exception class for web application errors

descr.p: EFpWebError is an exception class specifically for web application errors. It extends EFPHTTPError to provide HTTP-specific error handling with status codes and status text.

errors.p: This class represents errors that occur during web request processing.

element.name: ExceptionToHTML
element.short: Utility function to format exceptions as HTML error pages

descr.p: Formats an exception into a complete HTML error page with stack trace information. Generates a user-friendly error page that includes exception details, stack trace, and administrator contact information.
The generated HTML includes the application title, error message, stack trace with function names, and optional administrator email contact link.

errors.p: No specific errors during HTML generation.

element.name: ExceptionToHTML.S
element.short: String list to store the generated HTML content

element.name: ExceptionToHTML.E
element.short: The exception to format as HTML

element.name: ExceptionToHTML.Title
element.short: Application title for the error page

element.name: ExceptionToHTML.Email
element.short: Administrator email address for contact link

element.name: ExceptionToHTML.Administrator
element.short: Administrator name for the contact information
